description: Perspectives is both a fundamental and integrating course intended for MSOD students at any point in the program. It is particularly useful for those in their first year and for non-MSOD students. This course elaborates on central themes and ways of reading the dynamics of organizations. Lectures, discussions, creative reflection, and experiential learning are used to ground participants in the philosophy, theory and practice of Organizational Dynamics. Several faculty members highlight their specialities. The course requirements are active class contribution, a midterm paper and a final paper.
name: PERSPECTIVES OF ORG DYN
